content.raw: Right. We usually consider version 0.x as a non stable API in preparation for the 1.x series. These versions shared the same development package name `libfoo-dev`, no versions on it. Since sometimes the 0.x series are active for some time, the packages containing the shared library (those in the form of  `libfooX`) are versioned for 0.x/1.x so we can make changes in the ABI without breaking the runtime of current software build on top once the version 1.0 is out.
